channel.title: [SHOWOFF] Shift-click focusing
channel.description:
Yesterday, [url=http://www.reddit.com/r/runescape/comments/2u7tjs/suggestion_a_solution_that_may_eliminate_common/]Reddit user ColossusRage made a suggestion to eliminate misclicks[/url]. The suggestion involved holding a hotkey that would prevent walking and only allow interactions (clicking NPCs, objects, etc).
I decided to attempt an implementation of this in the 317refactor client, and it was much easier than I thought. Find the video below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mTFhzm68848

item.title: [SHOWOFF] Shift-click focusing
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:5, topic:549541”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=668438.msg4470600#msg4470600 date=1422728026]

Very nice idea indeed, just can’t think of when it’d be useful aside from directly attacking a monster (as opposed to right-click selecting “Attack”) or examining things (which sadly never works correctly on a private server).

It was suggested as a way to click on fast-moving entities (players or monsters) without accidentally clicking to walk.
[/quote]I don’t see why that would be useful. Even if you misclick to walk, you are still walking towards the entity so you waste less time.

Pretty sure whoever suggested this was just thinking of the effect that League has with the tilde key and thought it would be useful, but that does the opposite. It would let you walk to a title that has an entity on it without having to right click -> Walk here.[/quote]

Let’s say you’re on the left hand side of a monster, you attempt to click on the monster but it moves and you click on the other side of it. You then will run around to the other side of the monster. This will prevent that.
